meanings.definition: To direct too much or too forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overdirect the school play, telling everyone exactly what to do.
meanings.sent2: The coach had to remind himself not to overdirect the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The boss's attempt to overdirect every task led to chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her micromanaging style of overdirecting made her team feel suffocated.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant overdirecting made the students lose their creativity.

meanings.definition: Directed too much or too forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The overdirect manager made all the decisions without consulting the team.
meanings.sent2: His overdirect approach to leadership left no room for input from others.
meanings.sent3: The overdirect instructions on the package were confusing to follow.
meanings.sent4: The overdirect sunlight through the window made the room uncomfortably warm.
meanings.sent5: The overdirect criticism from the judge left the contestant feeling demoralized.
